title: Hatfield and the North - The Rotters' Club 1975
description:
Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Rotters' ClubÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (1975) is the second album by experimental Canterbury scene rock band Hatfield and the North.

Featuring some of the most stunning musicianship ever associated with England's Canterbury scene, Hatfield and the North's second LP features, like their eponymous debut, Dave Stewart on keyboards, Phil Miller on guitar, Richard Sinclair on bass and vocals, and Pip Pyle on drums; former members of Egg, Caravan, Matching Mole and Gong (supplemented by a few guest instrumentalists and the ever-ethereal Northettes on backing vocals).

Truly lovely music. 

One of the best Canterbury albums. 

Essential.



Hatfield and the North

1975

11. Chaos At The Greasy Spoon*

12. Halfway Between Heaven And Earth*

Personnel / Hatfield and the North:

Phil Miller - guitars

Pip Pyle - drums

Richard Sinclair - bass, vocals, guitar

Dave Stewart - organ, piano

with The Northettes:

Barbara Gaskin - backing vocals

Amanda Parsons - backing vocals

Ann Rosenthal - backing vocals

and

Mont Campbell - French horn

Lindsay Cooper - oboe, bassoon

Jimmy Hastings - flute, soprano & tenor saxophones

Tim Hodgkinson - clarinet
